item.title: Stacks Data Structure
item.description: Introduction # Stacks are powerful data structures with a simple yet versatile nature. They operate on the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle, making them ideal for tasks like: Undo/redo functionality in application Implementing compilers (syntax checking) Evaluating arithmetic expressions (e.
